definition: tending to spread especially in a quick or aggressive manner: such as
growing and dispersing easily usually to the detriment of native species and ecosystems
examples: It will be the second Australian insect released to thwart melaleuca, one of many exponentially spreading invasive plants that out-compete native Florida species, monopolizing wetlands and natural areas.
Scientists say more than 150 invasive species have entered the Great Lakes, multiplying rapidly and feeding on native species or outcompeting with them for food.

definition: tending to infiltrate surrounding healthy tissue, disseminating from a localized area throughout the body
examples: … this procedure preserves the architecture of the tissue sample, which is vital for determining whether tumor cells are invasive.

definition: involving entry into the living body (as by incision or by insertion of an instrument)
of, relating to, or characterized by military aggression
an organism that is not native to the place where found and tends to grow and spread easily usually to the detriment of native species and ecosystems
examples: Zebra mussels are the latest in a series of aquatic invasives to threaten Texas' inland waters.
